required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Pembrolizumab Plus Paclitaxel, Cisplatin Followed by Surgery for Locally Advanced ESCC
clinical_study.official_title: Efficacy and Safety of Pembrolizumab Plus Paclitaxel, Cisplatin Followed by Surgery in Patients With Locally Advanced Esophageal Squamous Cell Carcinoma

lead_sponsor.agency: Tianjin Medical University Cancer Institute and Hospital

clinical_study.source: Tianjin Medical University Cancer Institute and Hospital

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to observe and evaluate the efficacy and safety of pembrolizumab plus paclitaxel, cisplatin followed by Da Vinci robot radical surgery for locally advanced esophageal squamous cell carcinoma.

detailed_description.textblock: The Preoperative chemoradiotherapy with surgery is the standard treatment in NCCN guideline. But many patients refused or abandon radiotherapy because of the intolerable adverse effects. We designed a single-arm, open-label, phase II trial of pembrolizumab plus paclitaxel, cisplatin followed by Da Vinci robot radical surgery for locally advanced (stage III) esophageal squamous cell cancer. The purpose of this study is to observe and evaluate the efficacy and safety.

primary_outcome.description: Viable tumor comprised ≤ 10% of resected tumor specimens

secondary_outcome.description: Partial response is defined as a decrease by 30% or more in sums of longest diameter of measurable target lesions
Time from the enrollment to disease relapse after complete resection or death from any cause
Time from the enrollment to death of any cause

arm_group.description: Pembrolizumab 200mg, D1; Paclitaxel 135mg/m2, D2; Cisplatin 20mg/ m2，D2～D4; repeated every 3 weeks

intervention.description: preoperative therapy with three cycles: Pembrolizumab 200mg D1; Paclitaxel 135mg/m2 D2; Cisplatin 20mg/m2 D2-D4; repeated every 3 weeks

overall_official.affiliation: Tianjin Medical University Cancer Institute and Hospital

facility.name: Department of minimally invasive esophageal surgery, Tianjin Medical University Cancer Institute and Hospital
